messages.text: Anyone know what happened to <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/pull/20688> ? I'd be willing to pick it up if there's still a demand for this in Base.

elements.text: ? I'd be willing to pick it up if there's still a demand for this in Base.

messages.text: Looks like I posted a comment about what was required to make it actually compile and some feedback on changing the behavior and then the author never followed up

elements.text: Looks like I posted a comment about what was required to make it actually compile and some feedback on changing the behavior and then the author never followed up

messages.text: Introducing an `eachsplit` function seems like the easiest way forward

elements.text: function seems like the easiest way forward

messages.text: Hi, I made a crude implementation of `eachsplit` by converting the existing `split` implementation into an iterator and changing `split` to essentially `collect(eachsplit(...))` here: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/pull/39245> . I would appreciate tips on how to improve performance so that it is on par with the existing implementation of `split` (I'm aware there are CI issues; I figured I would wait for more changes before pushing again). Thanks!
